section.title: lms.djangoapps.commerce.signals module
section.paragraph: Signal handling functions for use with external commerce service.

desc_content.paragraph: Helper to get the authenticated user from the current HTTP request (if applicable).
If the requester of an unenrollment is not the same person as the student being unenrolled, we authenticate to the commerce service as the requester.
Signal receiver for un-enrollments, used to automatically initiate refunds when applicable.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.commerce.utils module
section.paragraph: Utilities to assist with commerce tasks.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: object
Helper class for ecommerce service integration.
Retrieve Ecommerce service public url root.
Return the absolute URL to the ecommerce page.

field_body.paragraph: ecommerce_page_url (str) – Relative path to the ecommerce page.
Absolute path to the ecommerce page.

desc_content.paragraph: Construct the URL to the ecommerce checkout page and include products.

list_item.paragraph: skus (list) – List of SKUs associated with products to be added to basket
program_uuid (string) – The UUID of the program, if applicable
course_run_keys (list) – The course run keys of the products to be added to basket.

field_body.paragraph: Absolute path to the ecommerce checkout page showing basket that contains specified products.

desc_content.paragraph: Return the URL to the ecommerce dashboard orders page.
Gets the URL for the Order Receipt page hosted by the ecommerce service.

field_body.paragraph: Receipt page for the specified Order.

desc_content.paragraph: Determines the availability of the EcommerceService based on user activation and service configuration. Note: If the user is anonymous we bypass the user activation gate and only look at the service config.
Return the URL for the checkout page.
Returns the URL for the user to upgrade, or None if not applicable.
Helper method to update an enrollment to a default course mode.

field_body.paragraph: True if auto-enroll is successful. False if auto-enroll is not applicable.

desc_content.paragraph: Create a Zendesk ticket via API.

field_body.paragraph: False if we are unable to create the ticket for any reason

desc_content.paragraph: Get the program price info from the ecommerce service.

list_item.paragraph: api_user – The user to use to make the request.
params – The params to use to make the request.

desc_content.paragraph: Checks to see if the django-waffle switch for disabling the account activation requirement is active
Attempt a refund of a course entitlement. Verify the User before calling this refund method

field_body.paragraph: True if the Refund is successfully processed.

desc_content.paragraph: Attempt to initiate a refund for any orders associated with the seat being unenrolled, using the commerce service.

list_item.paragraph: change_mode (Boolean) – change the course mode to free mode or not

definition_list_item.term: A list of the external service’s IDs for any refunds that were initiated

list_item.paragraph: requests.exceptions.RequestException – for any unhandled HTTP error during communication with the E-Commerce Service.
requests.exceptions.Timeout – if the attempt to reach the commerce service timed out.
